attribute.name: Unknown
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Attribute not supported
attribute.description: This attribute is not supported by this unit.

attribute.name: Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Indicates the rate of hardware read errors that occurred when reading data from a disk surface. The raw value has different structure for different vendors and is often not meaningful as a decimal number.

attribute.name: Throughput Performance
attribute.description: Overall (general) throughput performance of a hard disk drive. If the value of this attribute is decreasing there is a high probability that there is a problem with the disk.

attribute.name: Spin-Up Time
attribute.description: Average time (in milliseconds or seconds) of spindle spin up (from zero RPM - Revolutions Per Minute - to fully operational).

attribute.name: Start/Stop Count
attribute.description: Indicates a count of hard disk spindle start/stop cycles.

attribute.name: Reallocated Sectors Count
attribute.description: Count of reallocated sectors (1 sector = 512 bytes). When the hard drive finds a read/write/verification error, it marks this sector as "reallocated" and transfers data to a special reserved area (spare area). This process is also known as remapping and "reallocated" sectors are called remaps. The more sectors that are reallocated, the more read/write speed will decrease.

attribute.name: Read Channel Margin
attribute.description: Indicates a margin of a channel while reading data. Usually manufacturers do not use this parameter.

attribute.name: Seek Error Rate
attribute.description: Rate of seek errors of the magnetic heads. If there is a failure in the mechanical positioning system, a servo damage or a thermal widening of the hard disk, seek errors arise. More seek errors indicates a worsening condition of a disk surface and the mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: Seek Time Performance
attribute.description: Average performance of seek operations of the magnetic heads. If this attribute is decreasing, it is a sign of problems in the mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours
attribute.description: Indicates a count of hours in power-on state. The value of this attribute shows total count of hours in power-on state. A decrease of this attribute value to the critical level (threshold) indicates a decrease of the MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures).

attribute.name: Power-On Minutes
attribute.description: Indicates a count of minutes in power-on state. The value of this attribute shows total count of minutes power-on state. A decrease of this attribute value to the critical level (threshold) indicates a decrease of the MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures).

attribute.name: Spin Retry Count
attribute.description: Count of retry of spin start attempts. This attribute stores a total count of the spin start attempts to reach the fully operational speed (under the condition that the first attempt was unsuccessful). An increase of this attribute value is a sign of problems in the hard disk mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: Calibration Retry Count
attribute.description: This attribute indicates the number of times recalibration was requested (under the condition that the first attempt was unsuccessful). A decrease of this attribute value is a sign of problems in the hard disk mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: Is an informational parameter and indicates the count of full hard disk power on/off cycles.

attribute.name: Soft Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Uncorrected read errors reported to the operating system. If the value is non-zero, you should back up your data.

attribute.name: Soft Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Uncorrected read errors reported to the operating system. If the value is non-zero, you should back up your data.

attribute.name: SATA Downshift Error Count
attribute.description: Western Digital and Samsung attribute.

attribute.name: End-to-End error
attribute.description: This parameter is a part of HP's SMART IV technology and it means that after transferring through the cache RAM data buffer, the parity data between the host and the hard drive did not match. For detailed information see SMART IV Documentation from HP.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Error Count
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a number of errors that could not be recovered using hardware ECC (error-correcting code).

attribute.name: Command Timeout
attribute.description: The count of aborted operations due to HDD timeout. Normally this attribute value should be equal to zero and if the value is far above zero, then most likely there will be some serious problems with power supply or an oxidized data cable.

attribute.name: High Fly Writes
attribute.description: HDD producers implement a Fly Height Monitor that attempts to provide additional protections for write operations by detecting when a recording head is flying outside its normal operating range. If an unsafe fly height condition is encountered, the write process is stopped, and the information is rewritten or reallocated to a safe region of the hard drive. This attribute indicates the count of these errors over the lifetime of the drive.

attribute.name: Airflow Temperature
attribute.description: Airflow temperature on Western Digital HDs (Same as temperature (194), but current value is 50 less.)

attribute.name: G-sense/shock error rate
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the number of errors caused by externally-induced shock or vibration.

attribute.name: Power-off Retract Count
attribute.description: This attribute indicates the number of times the head was retracted as a result of power loss.

attribute.name: Load Cycle Count
attribute.description: Count of load/unload cycles into head landing zone position.

attribute.name: Hard Disk Assembly Temperature
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a hard disk drive current internal temperature. The raw value of this attribute shows built-in heat sensor registrations (in degrees centigrade).

attribute.name: Hardware ECC Recovered
attribute.description: Time between ECC (error-correcting code) corrected errors.

attribute.name: Reallocation Event Count
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a count of remap operations (transferring data from a bad sector to a special reserved disk area - spare area). The raw value of this attribute shows the total number of attempts to transfer data from reallocated sectors to a spare area. Unsuccessful attempts are counted as well as successful. Since this is a count value, it can only increase.

attribute.name: Current Pending Sector Count
attribute.description: This parameter is a critical parameter and indicates the current count of unstable sectors (waiting for remapping). The raw value of this attribute indicates the total number of sectors waiting for remapping. Later, when some of these sectors are read successfully, the value is decreased. If errors still occur when reading some sector, the drive will try to restore the data, transfer it to the spare area and mark this sector as remapped.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Sector Count
attribute.description: This parameter is a critical parameter and indicates the quantity of uncorrectable errors. The raw value of this attribute indicates the total number of uncorrectable errors when reading/writing a sector. A rise in the value of this attribute indicates defects of the disk surface and/or problems in the mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: UltraDMA CRC Error Count
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the total quantity of CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) errors during UltraDMA mode. The raw value of this attribute indicates the number of errors found during data transfer in UltraDMA mode by ICRC (Interface Cyclic Redundancy Check).

attribute.name: Write Error Rate
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the total number of errors appearing while recording data to a hard disk. This may be caused by problems with disk surface or the read/write heads.

attribute.name: Multi-Zone Error Rate
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the total number of errors appearing while recording data to a hard disk. This may be caused by problems with disk surface or the read/write heads.

attribute.name: Soft Read Error Rate
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the number of uncorrectable software read errors.

attribute.name: Data Address Mark errors
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the number of incorrect or invalid address marks.

attribute.name: Run Out Cancel
attribute.description: This parameter indicates that an invalid error correction checksum was found during error correction.

attribute.name: Soft ECC Correction
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the number of errors corrected by the internal error correction mechanism.

attribute.name: Thermal Asperity Rate
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the total number of problems caused by high temperature.

attribute.name: Flying Height
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the height of heads above the disk surface. The low value of this parameter increases the chances of a head crash while a flying height that is too high increases the chances of a read/write error.

attribute.name: Spin High Current
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the current needed to spin up the drive.

attribute.name: Spin Buzz
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the number of retries during spin up because of low current available.

attribute.name: Offline Seek Performance
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the seek performance of the hard drive during internal self tests.

attribute.name: Disk Shift
attribute.description: This parameter indicates that a distance of the disk has shifted relative to the spindle, which could be caused by a mechanical shock or high temperature. Unit of measure is unknown.

attribute.name: G-Sense Error Rate
attribute.description: Rate of errors occurring as a result of impact loads. This attribute stores an indication of a shock-sensitive sensor, that is, the total quantity of errors occurring as a result of internal impact loads.

attribute.name: Loaded Hours
attribute.description: Time spent operating under data load (movement of magnetic head armature). This value is constantly increasing (once per every hour).

attribute.name: Load/Unload Retry Count
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a number of drive head enters/leaves the data zone.

attribute.name: Load Friction
attribute.description: This parameter indicates the rate of friction between mechanical parts of the hard disk. The increasing value means there is a problem with the mechanical subsystem of the drive.

attribute.name: Load/Unload Cycle Count
attribute.description: Loading on magnetic heads actuator caused by numerous recurrences of operations like: reading, recording, positioning of heads, etc. Only the time when heads were in the operating position is counted.

attribute.name: Load 'In'-time
attribute.description: Total time of loading on the magnetic heads actuator (time not spent in parking area).

attribute.name: Torque Amplification Count
attribute.description: Number of attempts to compensate for platter speed variations.

attribute.name: Power-Off Retract Cycle
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a number of times the head was retracted as a result of power loss.

attribute.name: GMR Head Amplitude
attribute.description: Amplitude of heads trembling (Giant MagnetoResistive-head) in running mode.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a drive temperature.

attribute.name: Head Flying Hours
attribute.description: This parameter indicates time spent during the positioning of the drive heads.

attribute.name: Transfer Error Rate
attribute.description: If the device receives the reset during transferring the data, the transfer error is counted up.

attribute.name: Read Error Retry Rate
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a number of errors found during reading a sector from disk surface.

attribute.name: Free Fall Sensor
attribute.description: This parameter indicates a number of free fall events detected by the accelerometer sensor.

attribute.name: Raw Read Error Rate
attribute.description: The data field holds the raw sum of correctable and uncorrectable ECC (error-correcting code) error events over the life of the drive. If this ever exceeds 4.294.967.295, this value will wrap around.

attribute.name: Re-Allocated Block Count
attribute.description: This value gives the total bad block count of the drive minus the number of one-time programmable (OTP) bad blocks.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours Count
attribute.description: This value gives the raw number of hours that the device has been online over its life.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: This value gives the raw number of power cycle events that this drive has experienced.

attribute.name: Grown Failing Block Count
attribute.description: This value gives the total bad block count of the drive minus the number of one-time programmable (OTP) bad blocks.

attribute.name: Program Fail Count
attribute.description: This value contains the raw number of flash program failure events. If this value ever would exceed 65,535, it will stay at 65,535.

attribute.name: Erase Fail Count
attribute.description: This value contains the raw number of flash erase failure events. If this value ever would exceed 65,535, it will stay at 65,535.

attribute.name: Block Wear Leveling Count
attribute.description: Average erase count of all good blocks.

attribute.name: Unexpected Power Loss Count
attribute.description: The total number of times that the device has been power cycled unexpectedly.

attribute.name: Non 4k Aligned Access
attribute.description: This attribute contains two values: the low order 16 bits of the raw data contain the total unaligned reads counter, divided by 60,000, with a ceiling value of 65,535; the high order 16 bits of the raw data contain the total unaligned writes counter, divided by 60,000, with a ceiling value of 65,535.

attribute.name: SATA Interface Downshift
attribute.description: At completion of speed negotiation between host and device, the firmware records the value of the newly negotiated speed. This value is compared to the previously recorded value; if the new value is lower than the previous, a downshift has occurred and the downshift counter is incremented.

attribute.name: Reported Uncorrectable Errors
attribute.description: This value is the total number of ECC (error-correcting code) correction failures reported by the sequencer.

attribute.name: Command Timeouts
attribute.description: This counter is incremented by the number of outstanding commands when the host issues a soft reset, host reset, or a comreset. The raw data holds the value of this counter. If it ever exceeds 4.294.967.295, it will wrap around.

attribute.name: Factory Bad Block Count
attribute.description: One-time programmable (OTP) bad block count.

attribute.name: Reallocation Event Count
attribute.description: This value gives the total bad block count of the drive minus the number of one-time programmable (OTP) bad blocks.

attribute.name: Current Pending Sector Count
attribute.description: Will always be 0 because reallocation will be done on the fly.

attribute.name: SMART Off-Line Scan Uncorrectable Error Count
attribute.description: Uncorrectable errors detected during SMART off-line scan.

attribute.name: Ultra DMA CRC Error Rate
attribute.description: Gives the number of captured FIS interface general CRC (cyclic redundancy code) errors over the life of the drive, for both reads and writes, since the most recent power cycle. If this counter ever reaches 4.294.967.295, it will wrap around.

attribute.name: Percentage Rated Life Used
attribute.description: The average erase count of all blocks on Channel 0 CE 0 divided by the specified MaxEraseCount (10k for MLC or 100k for SLC), reported as a percentage from 0 to 100%.

attribute.name: Write Error Rate
attribute.description: Report the number of program failures divided by 60,000. If the value ever reaches 65,535, it will remain there thereafter.

attribute.name: Raw Read Error Rate
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Accumulated Runtime Bad Blocks
attribute.description: Cumulative number of retired blocks since leaving the factory.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours
attribute.description: Cumulative power on hours of the SSD.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: Cumulative number of power cycles of the SSD.

attribute.name: Available OP Sector Count
attribute.description: Number of Over Provision blocks still available.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count (unplanned)
attribute.description: The number of unplanned power cycles.

attribute.name: Initial Bad Block Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Program Failure Block Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Total programming failures
attribute.description: Total number of programming failures.

attribute.name: Erase Failure Block Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Total Erase Failures
attribute.description: Total erase failures.

attribute.name: Read Failure Block Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Total Read Failures (uncorrectable)
attribute.description: Total number of uncorrectable read failures.

attribute.name: Read Sectors Total Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Write Sectors Total Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Read Commands Total Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Write Commands Total Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Total Count of Read Sectors with Correctable Bits Errors
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Correction Read Errors Total Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Bad Block Full Flag
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Maximum PE Count Specification
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Minimum Erase Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Maximum Erase Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Average Erase Count
attribute.description: Average erase count.

attribute.name: Remaining Lifetime Percentage
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Indilinx Internal
attribute.description: Indilinx reserved attribute.

attribute.name: In Warranty
attribute.description: The raw value display if the SSD is in warranty (0=false, 1=true).

attribute.name: SATA Error Count CRC
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: SATA Error Count Handshake
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: DAS Polarity
attribute.description: The raw value display the polarity of the Drive Activity Signal (0=normal; 1=inverted).

attribute.name: Lifetime Remaining
attribute.description: The raw value display the reamining life as a percentage.

attribute.name: Host Writes (GB)
attribute.description: Total size of host writes in GB.

attribute.name: Host Reads (GB)
attribute.description: Total size of host read in GB.

attribute.name: Total NAND Programming Count (pages)
attribute.description: Total NAND programming count (pages).

attribute.name: Spin Up Time
attribute.description: The average time it takes the spindle to spin up. Since a SSD has no moveable parts, this attribute reports a fixed raw value of zero (0) and a fixed normalized value of 100.

attribute.name: Start/Stop Count
attribute.description: This type of event is not an issue for SSDs. However, hard disk drives can experience only a finite number of these events and, therefore, must be tracked. This attribute reports a fixed value of zero (0) and a fixed normalized value of 100.

attribute.name: Re-Allocated Sector Count
attribute.description: This attribute shows the number of retired blocks since leaving the factory (also known as a grown defect count). For 50nm drives, the normalized value has an initial value of 100 but counts up from 1, for every 4 grown defects. The normalized value of this attribute becomes 1 when there are 4 grown defects, then the value is 2 when there are 8 grown defects, etc. For 34nm drives, the raw value increments for every grown defect.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours Count
attribute.description: This attribute reports the cumulative number of power-on hours over the life of the device.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: This attribute reports the cumulative number of power cycle events (power on/off cycles) over the life of the device.

attribute.name: Available Reserved Space
attribute.description: This attribute reports the number of reserve blocks remaining. The attribute value begins at 100, which indicates that the reserved space is 100% available. The threshold value for this attribute is 10% availability, which indicated that the drive is close to its end life.

attribute.name: Program Fail Block Count
attribute.description: Percentage of NAND program failures.

attribute.name: Erase Fail Count
attribute.description: Percentage of NAND erase failures.

attribute.name: SATA Downshift Count
attribute.description: The count of the number of times SATA interface selected lower signaling rate due to error.

attribute.name: End to End Error Detection Count
attribute.description: This attribute is only available for 34nm drives and counts the number of times errors are encountered during logical block addressing (LBA) tag checks on the data path within the drive.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Error Count
attribute.description: The raw value shows the count of errors that could not be recovered using Error Correction Code (ECC).

attribute.name: Temperature - Airflow Temperature (Case)
attribute.description: Reports the SSD case temperature. Raw value suggests 100 - case temperature in C degrees.

attribute.name: Unsafe Shutdown Count
attribute.description: This attribute reports the cumulative number of unsafe (unclean) shutdown events over the life of the device. An unsafe shutdown occurs whenever the device is powered off without "standby immediate" being the last command.

attribute.name: Device Internal Temperature
attribute.description: Reports internal temperature of the SSD. Temperature reading is the value direct from the printed circuit board (PCB) sensor without offset.

attribute.name: CRC Error Count
attribute.description: The total number of encountered SATA interface cyclic redundancy check (CRC) errors.

attribute.name: Host Writes
attribute.description: This attribute reports the total number of sectors written by the host system. The raw value is increased by 1 for every 65,536 sectors written by the host.

attribute.name: Intel Internal
attribute.description: Intel first generation SSD internal attribute.

attribute.name: Timed Workload Media Wear Indicator
attribute.description: This attribute tracks the drive wear seen by the device during the last wear timer loop, as a percentage of the maximum rated cycles. The raw value tracks the percentage up to 3 decimal points. This value should be divided by 1024 to get the percentage. For example: if the raw value is 4450, the percentage is 4450/1024 = 4.345%. The raw value is held at 65,535 until the wear timer (attribute 228) reaches 60 (minutes).

attribute.name: Timed Workload Host Reads Percentage
attribute.description: This attribute shows the percentage of I/O operations that are read operations during the last workload timer loop. The raw value tracks this percentage and is held at 65,535 until the workload timer (attribute 228) reaches 60 (minutes). The normalized value is always set to 100 and should be ignored.

attribute.name: Workload Timer
attribute.description: This attribute is used to measure the time elapsed during the current workload. The attribute is reset when a "SMART execute offline immediate" subcommand is issued to the drive. The raw value tracks the time in minutes and has a maximum value of 232 = 4,294,967,296 minutes (8,171 years). The normalized value is always set to 100 and should be ignored.

attribute.name: Available Reserved Space
attribute.description: This attribute reports the number of reserve blocks remaining. The attribute value begins at 100, which indicates that the reserved space is 100% available. The threshold value for this attribute is 10% availability, which indicated that the drive is close to its end life.

attribute.name: Media Wearout Indicator
attribute.description: This attribute reports the number of cycles the NAND media has experienced. The normalized value declines linearly from 100 to 1 as the average erase cycle count increases from 0 to the maximum rated cycles. Once the normalized value reaches 1, the number will not decrease, although it is likely that significant additional wear can be put on the device.

attribute.name: Total LBAs Written
attribute.description: Counts sectors written by the host (1 sector = 512 bytes).

attribute.name: Total LBAs Read
attribute.description: Counts sectors read by the host (1 sector = 512 bytes).

attribute.name: Read Error Rate
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Throughput Performance
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Reallocated Sector Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Power-On hours Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Drive Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: SATA Phy Error Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Bad Block Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Erase Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Bad Cluster Table Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Unexpected Power Loss Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Current Pending Sector Counter
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Halt, Flash
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Firmware Version Information
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: ECC Fail Record
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Average/Max Erase Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Good/System Block Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Power-on Hours
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Power-on Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Program Fail Count Chip
attribute.description: Indicates a number of flash program failures.

attribute.name: Erase Fail Count Chip
attribute.description: Indicates a number of flash erase command failures.

attribute.name: Wear Leveling Count
attribute.description: Indicates the worst case erase count.

attribute.name: Used Reserved Block Count Chip
attribute.description: Indicates the number of a chip’s used reserved blocks.

attribute.name: Used Reserved Block Count Total
attribute.description: Indicates the worst case erase count.

attribute.name: Unused Reserved Block Count Total
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Program Fail Count Total
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Erase Fail Count Total
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Runtime Bad Block
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Error Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Temperature Exceed Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Airflow Temperature
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: ECC Rate
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: CRC Error Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Supercap Status
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Exception Mode Status
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Raw Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Raw error related to ECC errors. Correctable and uncorrectable RAISE (Redundant Array of Independent Silicon Elements) errors are included in the error count.

attribute.name: Retired Block Count
attribute.description: Tracks the total number of retired blocks. Data is calculated as 100-(100*RCB/MRB), where RCB is the retired block count and MRB is the minimum required blocks. Also an indicator of remaining life.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours and Milliseconds
attribute.description: Count of minutes and milliseconds in power-on state. The raw value of this attribute shows total count of minutes and milliseconds in power-on state.

attribute.name: Program/Erase Cycles
attribute.description: This attribute counts the number of flash program and erase cycles across the entire drive over the life of the drive.

attribute.name: Reserved Block Count
attribute.description: Number of reserved spares for bad block handling.

attribute.name: Program Fail Block Count
attribute.description: Counts the number of flash program failures.

attribute.name: Erase Fail Block Count
attribute.description: Counts the number of flash erase failures.

attribute.name: Unexpected Power Loss Count
attribute.description: Counts the number of unexpected power loss events since the drive was deployed.

attribute.name: Wear Range Delta
attribute.description: Returns the percent difference in wear between the most-worn block and least-worn block.

attribute.name: Program Fail Count
attribute.description: Four bytes used to show the program failures since the drive was deployed.

attribute.name: Erase Fail Count
attribute.description: Four bytes used to show the number of block erase failures since the drive was deployed.

attribute.name: Reported I/O Error Detection Code Rate
attribute.description: I/O Error Detection Code rate. This attribute tracks the number of end-to-end CRC errors encountered during host initiated reads and writes.

attribute.name: Reported Uncorrectable Errors
attribute.description: This attribute tracks the number of uncorrectable RAISE (Redundant Array of Independent Silicon Elements) errors reported back to the host for all data access commands.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: Temperature reported from the on-board sensor.

attribute.name: On the fly ECC Uncorrectable Error Count
attribute.description: This attribute tracks the number of uncorrectable errors.

attribute.name: Reallocation Event Count
attribute.description: This attribute tracks the number of blocks that fail programming which are reallocated as a result.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Sector Count
attribute.description: Uncorrectable sector count relative to the number of sectors read this power cycle. The normalized value is only computed when the number of bits is greater than 10^10. The count is cleared at power-on reset and wraps to 10^10 when it exceeds 10^12.

attribute.name: SATA CRC Error Count
attribute.description: SATA R-Errors (CRC) Error Count.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Soft Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Number of soft read errors that cannot be fixed on-the-fly and requires deep recovery via RAISE (Redundant Array of Independent Silicon Elements).

attribute.name: Soft ECC Correction
attribute.description: Number of errors corrected by RAISE (Redundant Array of Independent Silicon Elements) that cannot be fixed on-the-fly and requires ECC (multilevel) to correct.

attribute.name: Life Curve Status
attribute.description: A life curve used to help predict life in terms of the endurance based on the number of writes to flash.

attribute.name: SSD Life Left
attribute.description: A measure of the estimated life left, based on a combination of Program/Erase cycles and available reserve blocks. 100 is a new drive, 10 = replace as it has sufficient reserved blocks but the Program/Erase cycles have been used, 0 = insufficient reserved blocks, drive is read only to allow recovery of data on the drive.

attribute.name: Available Reserved Space
attribute.description: The number of reserved blocks remaining.

attribute.name: SandForce Internal
attribute.description: Sandforce reserved value.

attribute.name: Power Fail Backup Health
attribute.description: Power Fail Backup Health is an estimation of capacitive hold-up capability based on a timed discharge test, wherein discharge (past a pre-defined voltage threshold) faster than a predefined time-value threshold indicates a capacitor bank whose capacitance value is degraded past the point of reliability to protect SSD data. If an SSD has never run a "SuperCapacitor Test", the normalized value of this attribute remains at 100.

attribute.name: Lifetime Writes from Host
attribute.description: Indicates the total amount of data written from hosts since the drive was deployed. The number stored represents the number of bytes written by the host to the drive, in 64 GB increments.

attribute.name: Lifetime Reads from host
attribute.description: Indicates the total amount of data read to hosts since the drive was deployed. The number stored represents the number of bytes read by the hots from the drive, in 64 GB increments.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours
attribute.description: The Power-On Hours attribute specifies the total number of hours the drive has been operational. This counter starts when the drive is first manufactured and continues whenever the drive is powered on.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: The Power Cycle Count attribute indicates the total number of times power has cycled on the drive.

attribute.name: Power-Off Retract Count
attribute.description: The Power-Off Retract Count attribute returns the number of times the drive has been powered-off. This value is one less than the Power-Cycle Count attribute value.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: The Temperature attribute indicates the current drive temperature in degrees Celsius.

attribute.name: Number of ECC Errors
attribute.description: The Number of ECC Errors attribute specifies the number of sectors that encountered an ECC error and were recovered.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Errors Count
attribute.description: The Uncorrectable Errors Count attribute returns the number of uncorrectable ECC errors that occurred. This counter increments if more than four bits in the affected sector are uncorrectable.

attribute.name: UDMA CRC Error Count
attribute.description: The UDMA CRC Error Count attribute indicates the number of sectors that encountered a CRC error while in UDMA mode.

attribute.name: Minimum Spares Remaining
attribute.description: The Minimum Spares Remaining attribute indicates the number of remaining spare blocks as a percentage of the total number of spare blocks available.

attribute.name: Newly Added Flash Block
attribute.description: The Newly Added Bad Flash Block attribute indicates the total number of bad flash blocks the drive detected since it was first initialized in manufacturing.

attribute.name: Total Erase Block Count
attribute.description: The Total Erase Blocks attribute indicates the total number of times the drive has erased any erase block. Because a secure erase operation erases every block, this number increases significantly whenever a secure erase is performed

attribute.name: Reallocated Sector Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Power On Hours
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Power-On Time
attribute.description: The Power-On Time attribute indicates the total number of hours the drive has been operational. This timer starts when the drive is manufactured in production and continues whenever the drive is powered on.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: The Power Cycle Count attribute indicates the total number of times power has cycled on the drive.

attribute.name: Hardware configuration
attribute.description: Attribute identifies configuration as RAID-1 and identifies the media interfaces that exist.

attribute.name: Media presence
attribute.description: Attribute identifies whether media was present on those interfaces at last power-up.

attribute.name: Reset to Ready Timer
attribute.description: Attribute identifies the time in milliseconds from power-up until this logical unit indicated it was ready.

attribute.name: Rebuild Activity Completion Estimate
attribute.description: Attribute provides an estimate of the percentage of time remaining until the rebuild activity is complete.

attribute.name: Hard fault (all media)
attribute.description: Attribute identifies all the media that has experienced a hard fault.

attribute.name: Hard Fault - Bank 0
attribute.description: Attribute identifies the Bank 0 media that has experienced a hard fault.

attribute.name: Hard Fault - Bank 1
attribute.description: Attribute identifies the Bank 1 media that has experienced a hard fault.

attribute.name: Hard Fault - Bank 2
attribute.description: Attribute identifies the Bank 2 media that has experienced a hard fault.

attribute.name: Soft fault (all media)
attribute.description: Attribute identifies all the media that has experienced a soft fault.

attribute.name: Soft Fault - Bank 0
attribute.description: Attribute identifies the Bank 0 media that has experienced a soft fault.

attribute.name: Soft Fault - Bank 1
attribute.description: Attribute identifies the Bank 1 media that has experienced a soft fault.

attribute.name: Soft Fault - Bank 2
attribute.description: Attribute identifies the Bank 2 media that has experienced a soft fault.

attribute.name: Minimum Spares
attribute.description: The Minimum Spares attribute reports the number of spare blocks remaining as a percentage of the total spare blocks in the worst wear-leveling zone.

attribute.name: Power-Off Retract Count
attribute.description: The Power-Off Retract Count attribute returns the number of times the drive has been powered-off. This value is one less than the Power-Cycle Count attribute value.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: The Temperature attribute indicates the current drive temperature in degrees Celsius.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: Adtron temperature can report negative values, and other manufacturers cannot. The attribute value is degrees C, and the first byte of the raw data field is fractional degrees C. For example, value = 0x20 and raw [0] = 0x80 means 0x20.80 (hexadecimal), or 32.5 decimal.

attribute.name: Number of ECC Errors
attribute.description: The Number of ECC Errors attribute specifies the number of sectors that encountered an ECC error and were recovered.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Errors Count
attribute.description: The Uncorrectable Errors Count attribute returns the number of uncorrectable ECC errors that occurred. This counter increments if more than four bits in the affected sector are uncorrectable.

attribute.name: UDMA CRC Error Count
attribute.description: The UDMA CRC Error Count attribute indicates the number of sectors that encountered a CRC error while in UDMA mode.
